body:
I have following in `packages.yaml` : 

```bash
    packageA:
        compiler: [gcc@4.9.3]
```

Now if I try to build `packageB` with `clang` which has `packageA` as dependency, I thought `packageA` will be concretised with `gcc` but this is not the case. I can explicitly specify this at command line `... ^packageA %gcc@4.9.3`  but wonder if there is any way to enforce the rule/preferences specified in `packages.yaml`
title: How to enforce concretisation preferences specified in packages.yaml?
